intro: Solanum koniortodes, commonly known as the mountain nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a shrub that typically grows at high altitudes, often in rocky or alpine environments. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale purple, and it bears berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Solanum koniortodes belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other toxic and economically important plants. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic study.
